[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-08 18:27:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': "WIP: save connection_info during live migration

This is a test/WIP patch for fixing the issue of calling
Cinder's initialize_connection prior to removing volumes
on the source side, during live migration.

Calling Cinder's initialize_connection really should only be
done for attaching a volume.  We need to clean up other places
in Nova, but Cinder will need a new API for fetching existing
target/connection_info, instead of trying to create a new target,
which is what intialize_connection does for many cinder drivers.

Probably should have a bug associated as well....

Change-Id: Ie0af4563eebdb3fb5dab718201361e670a87b644
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: save connection_info during live migration

This is a test/WIP patch for fixing the issue of calling
Cinder's initialize_connection prior to removing volumes
on the source side, during live migration.

Calling Cinder's initialize_connection really should only be
done for attaching a volume.  We need to clean up other places
in Nova, but Cinder will need a new API for fetching existing
target/connection_info, instead of trying to create a new target,
which is what intialize_connection does for many cinder drivers.

Probably should have a bug associated as well....

Change-Id: Ie0af4563eebdb3fb5dab718201361e670a87b644

commit_message:
Make sure vmware resize on the same host

According to instance image_disk_format key's value vmdk and
flavor_id, make sure vmware instance resize on the same host.

Change-Id: Ie55a2f4af9fb9ee51ff5b022e92229e476478104
Closes-Bug: #1592654

The brq bridge should not have any IPv6 addresses, either
link-local, or on the tenant's private network due to the
bridge processing Router Advertisements from Neutron and
auto-configuring addresses, since it will allow access to
the hypervisor from a tenant VM.

The bridge only exists for the Neutron security group
code, so we can safely disable IPv6 on it.

Change-Id: I13accfeb29020fccc0fbd06fcca3b5c28fc2c67b
Closes-bug: 1302080
"}]
commit_message:
Disable IPv6 on bridge devices for LinuxBridgeManager

The brq bridge should not have any IPv6 addresses, either
link-local, or on the tenant's private network due to the
bridge processing Router Advertisements from Neutron and
auto-configuring addresses, since it will allow access to
the hypervisor from a tenant VM.

The bridge only exists for the Neutron security group
code, so we can safely disable IPv6 on it.

Change-Id: I13accfeb29020fccc0fbd06fcca3b5c28fc2c67b
Closes-bug: 1302080

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-09-27 08:04:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix libvirt resize down prevention for shared storage

When using ceph as backend, libvirt resize down prevention is
invalid, '_get_instance_disk_info' cannot get 'file' or 'dev' in
xml with ceph backend and skip. As a result, '_is_booted_from_volume'
cannot get 'disk' and treat it as booted_from_volume.

This patch replace the '_is_booted_from_volume' with the function
supplied by compute utils. And then 'Unable to resize disk down'
raised successfully.

Change-Id: I664f7ade774f1a73d470550f8c672dae30ad3f14
Closes-Bug: #1587802
"}]
commit_message:
Fix libvirt resize down prevention for shared storage

When using ceph as backend, libvirt resize down prevention is
invalid, '_get_instance_disk_info' cannot get 'file' or 'dev' in
xml with ceph backend and skip. As a result, '_is_booted_from_volume'
cannot get 'disk' and treat it as booted_from_volume.

This patch replace the '_is_booted_from_volume' with the function
supplied by compute utils. And then 'Unable to resize disk down'
raised successfully.

Change-Id: I664f7ade774f1a73d470550f8c672dae30ad3f14
Closes-Bug: #1587802

commit_message:
Modify workflow of rebuild_instance when schedule fails

Objects.migration is created in evacuate api before calling
rebuild_instance, and it's initial status is 'accepted'.
In nova.conductor, there's nothing to do about migration
when NoValidHost or UnsupportedPolicyException occurs.
I will fix it.

Change-Id: Ie4d5f3a5954fd0de517efe4c250e2d55ee277082
Closes-Bug: #1604384

commit_message:
Modify request numa_topology when resize

Currently request numa_topology uses instance's numa_topology when
resize, and this numa_topology is generated according to the old
flavor. This will cause select not right host in NUMATopologyFilter.
I will fix it.

Change-Id: I1c891b50a3e775031a5419f21a139a4decae0eba
Closes-Bug: #1598374

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "set innodb_file_per_table to ON for MySQL / Galera""

This reverts commit 3f7e74ab24bb43f9ad7e24e0efd4206ac6a3dd4e.

After identifying how to workaround the performance issues on the
undercloud, let's put this back in. Enabling innodb_file_per_table is
important for operators to be able to better manage their databases.

Change-Id: I435de381a0f0e3ef221e498f442335cdce3fb818
Depends-On: I77507c638237072e38d9888aff3da884aeff0b59
Closes-Bug: #1660722

subject: Increase sync timeout for nova db syncs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 18:11:48.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Increase sync timeout for nova db syncs

We have seen on lower quality hardware that the nova db syncs can take
an excessive amount of time. In order to still support deploying on this
hardware, let's increase the timeout from the default 300 seconds to 900
seconds to allow for this less performant gear. It is not recommended to
increase this past 900 as if we start hitting this then we need to be
understanding what is occuring in these db syncs. 300 seconds should be
enough time to setup a database especially on install. But there are
cases for upgrades or slower disks where it can exceed 300 seconds.

Change-Id: I77507c638237072e38d9888aff3da884aeff0b59
Related-Bug: #1660722
Related-Bug: #1661396
"}]
commit_message:
Increase sync timeout for nova db syncs

We have seen on lower quality hardware that the nova db syncs can take
an excessive amount of time. In order to still support deploying on this
hardware, let's increase the timeout from the default 300 seconds to 900
seconds to allow for this less performant gear. It is not recommended to
increase this past 900 as if we start hitting this then we need to be
understanding what is occuring in these db syncs. 300 seconds should be
enough time to setup a database especially on install. But there are
cases for upgrades or slower disks where it can exceed 300 seconds.

Change-Id: I77507c638237072e38d9888aff3da884aeff0b59
Related-Bug: #1660722
Related-Bug: #1661396

subject: Clear any previous environment in stackrc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 17:18:56.000000000', 'files': ['elements/undercloud-install/os-apply-config/root/stackrc'], 'message': "Clear any previous environment in stackrc

As was done in I6badc5864426a371323a59100155e1c284af84b8 for the
overcloud.  This is particularly a problem because right now we
only generate a v2 stackrc file, and if you switch from a v3
overcloudrc to the v2 stackrc you'll have v3 env vars left over in
the environment, which will likely break client usage.

Given that it's late in the cycle, I think this is the safest
change to make.  Adding v3 settings to stackrc can be a followup
in Pike.

Change-Id: I2ba3160656372fd73d51cfbe9de8f49dc983009d
Closes-Bug: 1661689
"}]
commit_message:
Clear any previous environment in stackrc

As was done in I6badc5864426a371323a59100155e1c284af84b8 for the
overcloud.  This is particularly a problem because right now we
only generate a v2 stackrc file, and if you switch from a v3
overcloudrc to the v2 stackrc you'll have v3 env vars left over in
the environment, which will likely break client usage.

Given that it's late in the cycle, I think this is the safest
change to make.  Adding v3 settings to stackrc can be a followup
in Pike.

Change-Id: I2ba3160656372fd73d51cfbe9de8f49dc983009d
Closes-Bug: 1661689

subject: Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-04 08:01:29.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I3ce96dbf5ecde08bf9b0dd2817e5f6355a60a430
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I3ce96dbf5ecde08bf9b0dd2817e5f6355a60a430

subject: Enable DevStack to set Keystone service name in config
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-03 10:49:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "Enable DevStack to set Keystone service name in config

With default DevStack settings, the Keystone service name is defined as
'identity'. However, Blazar expects it to be 'identityv3' by default. It
is used to get the corresponding Keystone endpoint from the service
catalog.

This patch makes the value configurable, which Jenkins jobs can use to
set the Keystone service name.

Change-Id: I9fdd4207d31364697e9721db5ea96ccc34efbbe7
"}]
commit_message:
Enable DevStack to set Keystone service name in config

With default DevStack settings, the Keystone service name is defined as
'identity'. However, Blazar expects it to be 'identityv3' by default. It
is used to get the corresponding Keystone endpoint from the service
catalog.

This patch makes the value configurable, which Jenkins jobs can use to
set the Keystone service name.

Change-Id: I9fdd4207d31364697e9721db5ea96ccc34efbbe7

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Id1f160c4bd42db582a620e6235bdebe73b8d21ed

Keystone API v2 was deprecated in Mitaka and uses "project"
instead of "tenant" in V3 now.

This patch change the "tenant" to "project" in Cinder API v3 doc.

Change-Id: I06d400f3e38d78014e9eae89b29b075adaecffe4
'}]
commit_message:
[api-ref]Change tenant to project

Keystone API v2 was deprecated in Mitaka and uses "project"
instead of "tenant" in V3 now.

This patch change the "tenant" to "project" in Cinder API v3 doc.

Change-Id: I06d400f3e38d78014e9eae89b29b075adaecffe4

oslo.service and deletes files only used by openstack.common.service.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 19:37:34.000000000', 'files': ['CONTRIBUTING.rst', 'tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING for this.

Change-Id: Ifc16055770e7bf765630814981e3d273876907a7
Needed-By: Icc2a8115cd0b5de165cab2076dbed890f28de172
(cherry picked from commit ffcb93e03b410658206df3a0dd72768634efe98b)
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING for this.

Change-Id: Ifc16055770e7bf765630814981e3d273876907a7
Needed-By: Icc2a8115cd0b5de165cab2076dbed890f28de172
(cherry picked from commit ffcb93e03b410658206df3a0dd72768634efe98b)

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING for this.

Change-Id: Ifc16055770e7bf765630814981e3d273876907a7
Needed-By: Icc2a8115cd0b5de165cab2076dbed890f28de172
(cherry picked from commit ffcb93e03b410658206df3a0dd72768634efe98b)

commit_message:
Use heat-params in systemd unit

Instead of sourcing heat-params in script, we can use it as a systemd
unit EnvironmentFile directive and not inline in sh scripts.

Change-Id: I3ebf23dee6785febdc87bc5ce4212c30ef24806e

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

Update CONTRIBUTING for this.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I3463e75057d0d4544f6a0212da888759ab5e171b
Needed-By: I92e6e6502c2c516babf2bf66f3514875f77c460e
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

Update CONTRIBUTING for this.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I3463e75057d0d4544f6a0212da888759ab5e171b
Needed-By: I92e6e6502c2c516babf2bf66f3514875f77c460e

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-01-14 18:09:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_cloudpipe.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_networks_associate.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_assisted_volume_snapshots.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_networks.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_flavor_manage.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_attach_interfaces.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1554631.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_floating_ips.py', 'nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_flavor_extraspecs.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_evacuate.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_server_tags.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_volumes.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_deferred_delete.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_security_groups.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_tenant_networks.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_admin_password.py', 'nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_fixed_ips.py', 'tests-functional-py3.txt', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_services.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_quota_sets.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_server_metadata.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_shelve.py'], 'message': 'Fixes to get all functional tests working on py35

tests-functional-py3.txt:
* Remove all tests except snowman from blacklist
* snowman seems to be a gabbi problem under py35

nova/objects/resource_provider.py:
* Cannot compare None and integer under py35
* wrap keys() in a list before comparing to a list as
  keys() is an iterator

nova/virt/fake.py:
* list_instance_uuids should return a list, keys() returns
    an iterator.

nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/*.py:
* use response.text to compare with a string as response.context
  contains bytes under python3
* user_data should be strings not bytes, so convert them
  as necessary

nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1554631.py:
* cinder exceptions need the http code as the first parameter
  (not a string)
* use response.text to compare with a string as response.context
  contains bytes under python3

nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py:
* zlib.compress needs bytes

Change-Id: I73be94afbb02dac46467555a8469f222a69025da
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes to get all functional tests working on py35

tests-functional-py3.txt:
* Remove all tests except snowman from blacklist
* snowman seems to be a gabbi problem under py35

nova/objects/resource_provider.py:
* Cannot compare None and integer under py35
* wrap keys() in a list before comparing to a list as
  keys() is an iterator

nova/virt/fake.py:
* list_instance_uuids should return a list, keys() returns
    an iterator.

nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/*.py:
* use response.text to compare with a string as response.context
  contains bytes under python3
* user_data should be strings not bytes, so convert them
  as necessary

nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1554631.py:
* cinder exceptions need the http code as the first parameter
  (not a string)
* use response.text to compare with a string as response.context
  contains bytes under python3

nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py:
* zlib.compress needs bytes

Change-Id: I73be94afbb02dac46467555a8469f222a69025da

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-14 15:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/placement_dev.rst'], 'message': "[placement] Add a bit about extraction plans to placement_dev

While we've not made any immediate plans to do the extraction we
should avoid adding complexity that would make it harder later, so
this new section discusses the plan to eventually extract, and the
structures that either help or hinder this.

commit_message:
[placement] Add a bit about extraction plans to placement_dev

While we've not made any immediate plans to do the extraction we
should avoid adding complexity that would make it harder later, so
this new section discusses the plan to eventually extract, and the
structures that either help or hinder this.

Change-Id: Ia3e95e4b85aa768b8f94d4a99963c7ec719b8a13
